intro: Procris elatostemoides, commonly known as the slender star-sedge, is a monocot belonging to the family Cyperaceae. It is characterized by its grass-like appearance, with narrow, linear leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in wet or marshy habitats, often in tropical and subtropical regions. Its inflorescence consists of a spikelet-like structure with three stamens and a single pistil. Procris elatostemoides is often found in wetlands and is adapted to thrive in waterlogged soils.
